dialogue: I got it. what happened now that we are going to have a celebration and a meeting at the same time?
I can only say it’s good news. In all these twenty-two years with your father, I was waiting for a day like this.
There are also things that you should be careful about, more than before. As it may impact your Dad negatively.
like what?
For example, your hijab. Like the photos, you post on Instagram. Most of the social behavior that others see. Some people might see and report them. It will be bad for Dad.
What does my Instagram have to do with Dad? also, one can use Instagram with a fake account.
That's what I'm talking about. You should know how to act properly. You should know where to go, who to hang out with, what to wear, what to say or not to say.
Look, every year on the first day of school, teachers ask what is your father's job? I used to say an employee until now. What should I say when schools start on Saturday?
I want to dye my hair blue this summer anyway.
If you turn your hair blue, I sure will turn your life black.
Also, you're going to remove your nail polish tonight before your dad comes. I don't want to deal with such trouble.
Mom, why are you doing this, don't you dye your hair yourself?
Do you understand the difference between a girl and a married woman?
What are you doing?
You’ve been staying home for just one day now, what’s all this fuss about? Don't you see what's going on?
what's going on Mom? People are living their lives.
Why do you two think you understand everything better than me and your father? is this life? Breaking the glass, setting things on fire.
Whatever they say on TV is true?
No, whatever you say is true! Listen, it’s saying that she had a heart problem. She had a stroke while in the custody of the morality police.
Would you say the same thing if she was your own daughter?
My daughter wouldn’t dare to go out dressed like that.
Well, maybe the law is wrong.
God's law is infallible.
Yes, Mom. I did.
Water bottle? I left it in the fridge for you last night.
No, I forgot that.
Do I have to remind you about that too? Buy mineral water, don't drink water from the tap.
OK, Mom, I'm not a child.
Keep your phone in your backpack, don’t get in trouble for it.
No, Mom, I won’t.
I will pick you up at one o'clock.
OK, bye.
Rezvan, weren’t you supposed to keep a proper distance from your friends?
Mom…
What's going on dear?
Come and pick me up, they say the school is closed.
Why dear? what happened?
It’s because of the protests. The girls are chanting.
Okay. I'll turn around right away, do not join them.
Come.
What was going on, sweety?
I don’t know. Kids were chanting.
What was the slogan?
Women, life, freedom.
Call Rezvan. I tried several times, but her phone was not available.
Not available.
Why?
Maybe the battery is dead.
Early in the morning? We’ll go after her, maybe by the time we get there she’ll have service again.
He said don't go this way.
Rezvan? Rezvan...

Iman, what happened? From what time? you mean there was no one at the university to say what time they closed the university? If that's the case, she should have reached home by now. okay. Okay. whatever comes up I’ll let you know.
what happened? Where are you now? We've been here for a few minutes. Okay, I'll see what I can do.
are you okay?
I got my period and I’m out of pads.
I have a bunch; I bring them right now.
Mom, sorry, but I need the small size. I can't use your pads. If you can't go to buy it, I will go myself.
Go and buy it yourself? You have no modesty, do you?
she is coming out of the parking lot now...
I'm coming down.
It is dangerous, we must take her to a hospital.
Sadaf, you’re not fine. You should see a doctor as soon as possible.
Dear, do you want me to drive you there?
who knows then?

You're just a kid. Why do you interfere in these matters? Well, both of you, listen carefully. This girl must have done something, the agents do not arrest someone for no reason, especially like this.
Mom, Rezvan was standing beside her. Those pellets could’ve hit Rezvan’s eyes.
Rezvan doesn’t dare to get in trouble, joining a riot. These are a bunch of thugs coming to the streets to run naked.
Mom, for god’s sake, let it go.
What? Let it go? do you think you can do whatever in this house? I will tell your father everything tonight, then it’s between you and him.
Fruit, mutton, one kilo of minced meat, one and a half kilo of backstrap, breadcrumbs, fresh herbs, vegetables, salad ingredients. Walnuts, olives, and garlic.
Add turmeric and black pepper.
Mom, what are you doing?
No matter what, I will find this gun.
hasn’t she told you anything?
Mom, do you want to pick on me now?
Didn't you want to dye your hair blue? Your father is here, he promises to let you dye your hair blue. Tell her Iman, tell her you allow her to do so.
Mom... Mom.
what is this?
It's on the internet. It's the father's information, they wrote the home address as well.
Oh God, oh Lord.
Sana!!!
We are talking, mom.
What kind of conversation is this?
I am asking a question.
Faith means not questioning everything.
It shouldn't have come to this.
I hate his behavior.
Your mistake is that you never stood up to him.
All my life, I have tried hard so that you never see this side of your father.
Do you want to say which one of you has the gun?
I’m here.
Sana, my darling, are you okay?
Yes, I’m fine, Mom.
What are you doing?
I’m getting you out.
Sana, dear, your dad is not well. Give him the gun and everything will end here.

It doesn't end, mom, nothing’s going to end. Everything has been like this ever since I can remember. You’ve always surrendered and gave him whatever he wanted. It's the same now, even if he takes the gun, it won't end.
Dad, I swear to God, I’ll shoot you, don't...
Rezvan, tell him to stop.
